case_vignette: A 14-YEAR-OLD MALE PRESENTING TO DERMATOLOGY CLINIC WITH ROSY CHEEKS AND A HISTORY OF EASY SUNBURNS AND FREQUENT RESPIRATORY INFECTIONS. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION DEMONSTRATES A PROMINENT NOSE AND EARS, TELANGIECTATIC ERYTHEMA IN A MALAR DISTRIBUTION, AND FAINT HYPOPIGMENTATION ON THE CHEEKS.  GENETIC TESTING IS PERFORMED AND REVEALS A BLM/RECQL3 MUTATION.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have rosy cheeks, and I get sunburned very easily. I also get frequent respiratory infections.
How old are you and what is your sex?
I am a 14-year-old male.
Do you experience any joint pain or swelling?
No, I do not experience any joint pain or swelling.
Do you have any family members with similar symptoms or any diagnosed autoimmune conditions?
I don't have any information about family members with similar symptoms or diagnosed autoimmune conditions.
Have you noticed any changes in the skin texture or sensitivity, besides being prone to sunburn?
Yes, I have noticed faint areas of lighter skin on my cheeks.
Have you experienced any fatigue or general weakness recently?
No, I haven't experienced any fatigue or general weakness recently.
Final Diagnosis: Bloom Syndrome
